item.name: Agricola
item.comment:
I ordered this and it got charged to my visa so it must be on its way!
UPDATE AUG: It finally arrived and is worthy!
I grow tired of action points to goods to victory points. Enough with the mechanic.
Update: Truly one of the greatest games ever made. Worker placement exhaustion included....at least its not a deck building game though its starting to look like one.

item.name: Agricola X-Deck
item.comment:
Everything it needs to be. Proof that gamers are like minded individuals.
I love it.

item.name: Agricola: The Legen*dairy Forest-Deck
item.comment:
Unbalances the game terribly with five. The first two players will always take wood and always draw this.
Broken. Only Agricola addition I would NOT recommend.

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: Great game. Great replayability. Easy to learn. This is a small step above other intro games.

item.name: Arctic Scavengers
item.comment: Looking forward to some expansions.

item.name: The Ark of the Covenant
item.comment: Good game play. Simple to play and teach. Great biblical spin on this great game. The 'field' rules give an unfair adavntage to one player.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: I had a few solitaire goes at this but I'm not going to show it to my game group. Its far too creepy. The art, the flavor text, everything gave me the heeby jeebies. I suppose that was the point.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The King in Yellow Expansion
item.comment: Not enough of an expansion.

item.name: Axis & Allies
item.comment: Same old axis and allies. Great for its time, not so good now with the new generation of wargames...

item.name: Axis & Allies
item.comment: We all love it. But not too much. 2210 is better.

item.name: Axis & Allies Naval Miniatures: War at Sea
item.comment: Excellent gameplay. Miniatures are great to scale models but the paint jobs are a little light. I am impressed with the historical accuracy of the game and highly recommend it. I love the "taking damage after you've had a chance to shoot" rule. It makes for less meandering trying to get the first shot which most miniature games suffer from.

item.name: Battleball
item.comment: Fantastic. Light and fun. Play this.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment: Meh. This game did not age well. Downgraded.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: The theme is fantastic. Just when you think the Galactica is sorrounded and doomed. YOu jump! Really captures the series. LOVE IT LOVE IT.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica Collectible Card Game
item.comment: Fantastic. This plays really well multiplayer and is not difficult to get good decks. Cheap too. Worth picking up the starter and some boosters. Don't not get this. Perfect for Magic and Shadowfist fans.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
item.comment:
lacking in rule clarity completely. Fun until the second half starts. from there it gets misleading and hard to play. I have given the game more than a dozen goes and never been satisfied with the result - always hoping that the next scenario will work out.
Despite this the game is incredibly fun! There is no other game that I have such mixed feelings about. I traded it a while back so my friends would stop asking for it. I'd love another copy.
Worthy of a proper reprint!* acquired new edition. Finally! Too bad its not as good of quality...I miss the kidney token...

item.name: Blokus
item.comment:
this game online is so much fun. It absolutely rocks. Best abstract ever.
There is a giant version where the squares are 1" by 1" and I want it!

item.name: Blueprints
item.comment: Thouroughly enjoyable.

item.name: Boggle
item.comment: What can I say? Its boggle...

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: I've got the fan edition. Just as good. Smaller and cheaper.

item.name: Brew Crafters
item.comment: A great game. Its a little short at 12 rounds though.

item.name: Caesar & Cleopatra
item.conditiontext: My girlfriend likes it. Quit simple to play.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: This is fun fun fun.

item.name: Catacombs
item.comment:
Mold was resolved by the company at no cost to me. AWESOME. Looking forward to any and all expansions.
Great game. Horrid artwork. I still rank it a ten because atleast they didn't use CG.
..board needs to be bigger.

item.name: Catan
item.comment: So good. 100 plays a year. EDIT: Comment from 2004.

item.name: Catan Dice Game
item.comment: I'd rate my personal copy a "10" because Klaus Teuber signed my copy.

item.name: Catan Histories: Struggle for Rome
item.comment: The end game is pretty weak where you "settle" - I think I am playing it wrong. At least I hope I am.

item.name: Cave Troll
item.comment: Thouroughly enjoyable and replayable.

item.name: Caylus
item.comment:
I had the limited edition copy in my hands at Essen '07. I didn't buy it. WHY! I will forever be perplexed by this.
Edit: Acquired the special edition. YES!!!
Normal Caylus for trade.

item.name: Caylus
item.comment: Special Edition is superb.

item.name: Chess
item.comment: I love chess.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: I bought the German version. Note to self: This game IS language dependent.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients
item.comment:
I see no reason to own this and memoir 44. Same game as far as I am concerned. I don't care which game came first.
Quality of the board is TERRIBLE.
I get really annoyed when a board won't lay flat.And its an 80! dollar game.

item.name: Condottiere
item.comment: Small, Cheap, fun, battles! What is there not to like?

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment:
This game is awfull. Some of the races are ridiculously powerfull. Why bother.
Yes, RG used to play this and he invented magic - get over it.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment:
Terrible.
Always has been. Always will be.

item.name: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation Boardgame
item.comment: Absolutely terrible. DO NOT PLAY.

item.name: Cuba
item.comment:
Broken.
Beautiful components though.

item.name: Dragon Dice
item.comment:
So far I love it. Its complex with the new rules but worthwhile. Plus I love that all old dice are still compatible!
This game is really fun!

item.name: Duel in the Dark
item.comment: Finicky but maybe I haven't played it enough.

item.name: Dungeon Twister
item.comment: I can never seem to win this one. Its good. Worth playing with mechanics long in the making. Be carefull of getting into camping situations.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
Earth Reborn
item.comment: Christmas '10 from my daughter Zion. AWESOME.

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment: This game is awesome - worth all the hype. The end game smacks of Agricola - just when things are organized and you're feeling fine. BAM. Game over. Not a bad thing. Keeps the game contained.

item.name: EVE: The Second Genesis
item.comment: Great CCG - probably the best sci-fi CCG out there. This has great gameplay and the cards look fantastic. Moderately easy to learn. I highly recommend this game.

item.name: The Forever War
item.comment: Why do I own this?

item.name: Fury of Dracula (second edition)
item.comment: This is a fantastic 2 player game. Also makes a great multiplayer game. Quite short games actually. The real fun is the challenge in trying to kill Dracula. Very very good and very different game.

item.name: Galactix
item.comment: Bad. But better than some.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment:
Picked this up at Essen 2007. Great game so far. Lacking depth but fun.
I used to have this rated higher but it falls a little flat. As a two player it really isn't the greatest game either.
Building the ship is fun and my first few games were a blast so I have to give it credit there...

item.name: Gears of War: The Board Game
item.comment: Wrath of Ashardolan and company is way more immersive and much more fun.

item.name: Glory to Rome
item.comment: Excellent game. I hate how cartoony it is though. I'd rank this a ten if the theme and cards were more classy. Mike demands better theme!

item.name: Grave Robbers From Outer Space
item.comment: For what this is it is fantastic! Not the most balanced game, however. It is a short play (30 min to an hour) and it plays great two player (which is a bonus) and even better multiplayer. This is a must own. EASY to explain, EASY to play. This is something your girlfriend could play....

item.name: Grave Robbers II: Skippy's Revenge
item.comment: Its pretty good. You may need to burn a few over powerfull "kill by such and such only cards bc they make it impossible to win sometimes....

item.name: Hacienda
item.comment: Seems almost too balanced. Is that possible? Where is the strategy for winning? Maybe I am missing something.

item.name: Halo ActionClix
item.comment: I bought the Scarab and it rocks!

item.name: Le Havre
item.comment: No wonder this gem is so hard to find! Everything a euro was meant to be.

item.name: HeroClix
item.comment: Fantastic.

item.name: Heroes of Graxia
item.comment: I like it. I like the PVP. Its encouraged and good multiplayer. Works well with 2 players too..

item.name: HeroQuest
item.comment: This is a must own. If you see this game or parts of it for less than 50$ purchase immediatly. The classic RPG. Gives lots of room to create your own quests. Satisfies that RPG craving. I recommend buying player made expansions on ebay. (there are several)
item.conditiontext: Two Copies - plus internet expansion thing.

item.name: High Stakes Drifter
item.comment: Stupid game. Hard to learn how to play. Collectible.

item.name: HorrorClix
item.comment:
This is a great game. The addition of plot twist cards and the online scenarios are fantastic. PLUS no bits are overly powerfull and multiple strategies can be employed. A real step above in fun factor over Heroclix. The "cards" though cumbersome bc they can be lost or destroyed make it much easier to play a more complex clix game. Thumbs up.
PLUS there is a great spread of characters. The robots and sci-fi additions from the lab are great (aliens vs predator!!). Hopefully more movies will have product placement like screamers, starship troopers, nightmare before christmas, Terminator, or even Star Wars.

item.name: I Don't Know, What Do You Want To Play?
item.comment: I wish this worked.

item.name: Inn-Fighting
item.comment: Kinda Lame.

item.name: Innovation
item.comment: I just love this game. Why is it so good? Its just awesome.

item.name: Khet: The Laser Game
item.comment: Great little game. Perfect for fans of Chess. Well balanced and fun.

item.name: Kill the Hippies
item.comment: Hilarious christian in Jokes. Perfection in humour.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
item.comment: Far too random and collectible and the theme is wierd.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment: Secret Santa 2008! Oh yeah. A big thanks to the provider of Kingsburg. Its a thin year for me and this made my holidays. Thankyou!!!!

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Duel
item.comment: Cool.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment:
I liked this more actually playing it then I did when I first did a run through on my own. You can really foil a guys plans with a well played intrigue card - which is the major difference here between this and other worker placement games. Other than that wholly derivitive. Not a single unique mechanism in the whole game.
Its too bad I am totally burned on worker placement or I'd've liked this more. If I only owned three worker placements this would be one of them:
Agricola Caylus Lords of Waterdeep ...possibly alien frontiers. but thats it!...and glen more? too many good games.
I really wish this had come out before stone age. To think of all the worker placement fatigue i got from that game when I could have been playing this.

item.name: Mage Knight
item.comment:
Great game. I prefer Mage Knight Dungeons but this is still great.
WANTED: Heroes and dungeon parts and styrene cards and anything to do with mage knight dungeons. Heroe's especially.
REALY WANTED: Apocalypse riders. Name your price in trade or Ca$h. (not the super rare versions)

item.name: Mage Knight Dungeons
item.comment:
Fantastic! The best add on to a CLIX game ever. You have to buy this as a fan of heroquest, mechwarrior, mageknight, or a fan of fun in general....
Allows for a dungeon crawl framework to an otherwise "basher" game. Fun fun fun.
The "collectability" is a positive bc there are literally hundreds of monsters on the market for dirt cheap prices that you can bash through the dungeon. Grabbing new heroes is an issue though but they come with the set and you can always get more online or, heaven forbid, buy a booster.

item.name: Make Your Own Opoly
item.comment: Do not purchase this. It comes with very very little and it sucks. Good idea but they don't provide you with enough paper to make a convincing game. Do not buy. Better idea is to buy an old used monopoly and some "sticker" paper and make your own...

item.name: Mechwarrior: Dark Age
item.comment: Good game. Not as good as robotech but worth owning and playing occasionally..

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment: This is a great WWII simulator. I can't say enough about the unique, simple mechanics. Yet, lots of decision making and great gameplay. You owe yourself this game.

item.name: Memoir '44: Terrain Pack
item.comment: Not enough new scenario's! I want more.

item.name: Metro
item.comment: This is like Tsuro but with more rocks.

item.name: Monopoly: Star Wars
item.comment: My copy is so worn from being overplayed I must have liked it at some point...

item.name: Mwahahaha!
item.comment: I give a rating of "meh" to "mwahahaha"

item.name: Neuroshima Hex!
item.comment: Picked this up at Essen 2007. Great two player game. You must own this. New simple mechanic any gamer will love. Unlike any two player game you've ever played.

item.name: Neuroshima Hex! Doomsday Machine 1.0
item.comment: Essen Rocks!

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment:
I really enjoy this. There are REASONS to attack each other which most games like this lack. Also, the mission cards work great. Even if you have a smaller army and smaller income generation you can still win by completing your missions.
UPDATE: I still love this game. LOVE IT. UPDATE: Every time I play this its so fun. Updating to ten. UPDATE: There are better games: Runewars (#1), Cyclades, Kemet....its just old.

item.name: Ninja: Legend of the Scorpion Clan
item.comment:
Its a TEN being the ninja. About a 5 not being the ninja. Easily solved by playing two games.
I admit I haven't not been the ninja very often. Perhaps more plays will convince me otherwise.
Needless to say being the ninja is some of the best boardgaming you will ever do. Its just damn cool sneaking around and killing stuff. Love this game. Highly recommend it.

item.name: Node
item.comment: Tigris and euphrates the card game.

item.name: Oshi
item.comment: Lots of fun. A definite must own. Purchase this when you see it. The publisher has a history of limited runs. Simple and intricate. Very easy to learn. (As good as Tsuro) I found the presentation and pieces a little more budget than what I expect from Wizkids - I'd give it a ten if the piecesd were of a higher quality. The board is of very high quality why not make bits to match? However, fun to play and a great 2 player game to add to my collection. This is a great game for fans of chess, tsuro, deflexion, go etc...

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: Good cooperative game. Lacks replayability once you figure it out. Good for about 10 games.

item.name: Paranoia Mandatory Bonus Fun! Card Game
item.comment: The RPG is way better obviously. Hard to learn. There needs to be a rule clarification somewhere.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
The Pillars of the Earth
item.comment: This is a fantastic uber-euro. I love it.

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Set
item.comment: A worthy expansion to a great game.

item.name: Pirate Dice: Voyage on the Rolling Seas
Pirates of the Spanish Main
item.comment: I buy so many of these little ships and bust this game out so often that I have to rank it a "8". Wizkids has really done a good job by adding the creatures into the mix and the gameply is simple and the pieces are exceptional and the concept is fantastic. This game is going to be around for a long long time,,
item.wantpartslist: Personel. there is never enough men to go around

item.name: Pirates: Quest for Davy Jones' Gold
item.comment: This is not a must have for your pirates collection if you are a collector and the ships that come with it are not worth buying the game for (they aren't compatible with pirates CSG). All you are really purchasing here is a vinyl play mat that you do not need.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment:
This is a fantastic game. The play style is unique, though it is incredibly tough to explain. Once you start playing, however, people get right into it.
There is a bandwagon for a reason!

item.name: Puerto Rico: Expansion I – New Buildings
Quarriors!
item.comment: Awesome. Your life sucks if you dont own this.

item.name: Race Day
item.comment: A good little dice game for kids. This is fun and worth owning. Pick em up before they are gone forever!!

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: I LOVE San Juan. I LOVE this sci fi version of saun jaun way more.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War
item.comment: SS 2010 thankYOU!

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
item.comment: Secret Santa 2008 - Thanks. This is a wonderfull edition to a fantastic game. I want to see these cards start to come out like magic cards!! Bring on the RFTG CCG!!!

item.name: Red November
item.comment: I wouldn't play this again.

item.name: Redemption: City of Bondage
item.comment: Too simple. Great for fans of redemption as an ease in to the card game. Worth playing a few times.

item.name: Ricochet Robots
item.comment: Seriously impressive, addictive, little puzzle solver game. LOVE it. Got it on sale at my local. Not even on my radar or anything. What a pleasant surprise.

item.name: Risk 2210 A.D.
item.comment: A game I play this much I have to rank a 9. There's just something so accessible about this game. When you have established a few finicky things about the rules it's wholly unlike risk but with all the same exciting army building love. Play to the end (instead of the standard five rounds) and get ready for a long good night of gaming.

item.name: RoboRally
item.comment: I had alot of fun with this game. Worth every cent.

item.name: Runebound (Second Edition)
item.conditiontext: This is a great game. Really quenches the boardgame and D&D urge. I just got it and all the expansions so I am super excited about it still.

item.name: Runewars
item.comment:
Best looking FFG yet! Love how small the miniatures are.
This game is fantastic. Great work by the designers. Highly recommend universal head rules sheet. All you need.

item.name: Saboteur
item.comment:
This game is nothing short of fantastic. Probably my favorite game to pull out with new and experienced people. You must play this.
It is extremely engaging.

item.name: The Settlers of Canaan
item.comment: As good as catan except with a static board. 12 points and stones for jerusalem are a good add in and make game play more exciting and resources more scarce. i love this game.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: The Fishermen of Catan
The Settlers of Catan: The Great River
Shadowfist
item.comment: This is a great CCG. Its recent resurgance is going to be fantastic for the game. This is one good game.

item.name: Shadowrun Duels
item.comment: This is fantastic. I picked it up for cheap on a whim and I love it. No other game like it. Kind of like a giant clix game where you can customize the weapons of your clix and therefore the dice etc etc. I should write a review.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: I really enjoyed this team game. This is a great change of pace from battling each other to battling the mechanics of the game. Really quick turn sequences unless your playing with morons...

item.name: The Spoils
item.comment: Not impressed.

item.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game
item.comment: Don't be fooled. This is a great game. Specialty die. Lots of decisions. It really gives the feel of being at the 'com'. This is worthwhile and a little rare.I'll pay good money for any sets that are out there.Just remember you need BOTH the federation and the Borg\klingon sets to play a game.

item.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – Interactive VCR Board Game – A Klingon Challenge
Star Wars PocketModel TCG
item.comment: This is a pretty good game. A little hard to learn out of the book. Checkout the wizkids site for the walk through. The ships and figures are incredible. I love the Shuttle Tydirium, its brilliant.

item.name: Star Wars: Epic Duels
item.comment: This is over hyped. It seems far too simplistic. Am I missing something

item.name: Star Wars: The Queen's Gambit
item.comment:
The only card driven game I need. Pure awesome. Its tense and fun and always down to the wire. Very well balanced and a huge surprise.
Unfortunately it will never be reprinted.

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game
item.comment: Reminds me of playing tie-fighter circa 1997. Lots of flying around and hoping for that shot. Excellent game. Fantasy Flight did an excellent job here. Highly recommend it.

item.name: Starbase Jeff
item.comment: Best Cheapass game.

item.name: Starfarers of Catan
item.comment: beautiful game. A must play for settlers fans. better with 4 poeple and expansion. Short and hard fought. very different from other games and kinda hard to explain, though, not rulebook hard like axis or anything, just hard to explain -- easy to play. Play it and then explain it to someone and then you'll see.

item.name: Starship Catan
item.comment: Best two player game out there. Other two player games don't even compete with this. This is NOT a card game. It doesn't even fall in the same category as lost cities or ceasar and cleopatra. This is a two player board game and its lots of fun. Massive replayability.

item.name: Start Player: A Kinda Collectible Card Game
item.comment: Essential.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment:
I would play this anytime. Only complaint is that the mechanic is a little over used these days - it really felt like pillars of the earth until the scoring....
Overall however, great experience

item.name: Stratego: Star Wars
item.comment: Great two player game. Massive replay ablity . Short game times. Star wars version is wonky because the numbers are backwards (ex ten is the highest instead of one) Also, the addins and character bonus' are stupid but you can and must play without them.

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!
item.comment: ATTENTION. You have to play this game. Hopefully someone, somewhere, will make a non-3d expansion to this game.

item.name: Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment: meh. Not really a game. Worth experiencing it...once..

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment: I like the scope of the game though I am finding it difficult to learn. Lots going on here.

item.name: Through the Desert
item.comment: Great area control game. Recommended purchase. Good for two and for five alike.

item.name: Thunderstone
item.comment: Best deck builder I own. Love all the expansions.

item.name: Thunderstone: Wrath of the Elements
item.comment: Essential expansion to Thunderstone. If only for the box!

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: Good for non-gamers, sisters, and girlfriends. Europe version is better.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Europe
item.comment:
Good for sisters and girlfriends. Easy fun and fast.
Essentially replaced by Hacienda.

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment:
Some crazy ass dude came up with this. Where do you think of something this awesome and balanced?
Worthy of all its praise. Tough to learn. Tough to teach. Should be #1 on the geek.

item.name: Torres
item.comment: Awesome.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: The Lord of the Rings Movie Trilogy Collector's Edition
item.comment: This is a great trivial pursuit game. A little easy at times. The only drawback is the outcome is mostly centered around the "brown" wedge. These questions have to do with the making of the movie and are either near impossible or very rarely incredibly easy. I don't know who did makeup for Elf #34!!

item.name: Tsuro
item.comment:
Beautifull game. Well made and easy and fun. YOU could play this with your mom. You could also play all night with your friends. Makes a great drinking game.....
This has been lost since 2009. Who has it? I want it back...

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
item.comment: Fantastic. Worth every second.

item.name: War of the Ring (first edition)
item.comment:
Amazing. First time will take 9 hours to play.(3 hours to learn the rules) Second time will take 5. This is a must have for LOTR fans. Best two player war game! - No contest.
There really isn't enough that you can say about this game. It is different every time you play it, it is not luck dependant, you always feel like you are "in" it, and the theme is not only good, it is perfectly suited. Lots went into this game and you can get lots out.

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment:
One of the few party games I will actually play.
Need new cards...

item.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game
item.comment: Its pretty good. Better than magic. Lots of cards. Thats actually the best part. Lots and lots of cards.

item.name: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame
item.comment: The endgame is kinda lame. I enjoyed beefing up my character though. There is lots of "stuff" for your character if you are into this.

item.name: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – BlizzCon Epic Armor Pack
item.comment:
LOVE IT.
Especially the murloc suit.

item.name: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – Shadow of War
World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – The Burning Crusade
Zombies!!!
item.comment: For what this is. I enjoy it immensely. The perfect filler.

item.name: Zooloretto
item.comment:
Fantastic. Great for friends, family, and gamers alike. Easy to play hard to master and great theme.
Must have.
